author: Peter Darwen
title: Walking with my mother
description: Peter recounts his first walks around Diglis, and how the space opened up with the opening of the walking bridge.

author: Lilliana Veronik Mazzocchi
title: After school hangout
description: Lilliana has some of her fondest memories of spending time with friends around the play area in Diglis fields.

author: Nicky Boraston
title: My car wasn't where I left it
description: Nicky recalls a rude awakening to find her car in neither the place nor the state she left it in.

author: Rupert Breakspear
title: Treasures in the nature reserve
description: Rupert talks about the rare species he's come across while strolling through the nature reserve.

author: Debbie Bourne
title: What draws us to Diglis
description: Debbie explains how she was originally drawn to the fields for her dog, but stays for the other benefits!

author: Minty White
title: Lockdown walks with Bertie
description: Minty and Bertie got to know their community through the lockdown of 2020, and made many friends in the process.

author: Hayley Bretherton
title: Walking the dog opens up Diglis
description: Haley explains how having a dog opened up parts of Diglis she'd never explored before.

author: Sarah Gateley
title: Diglis as a garden
description: Sarah talks about being without a garden when first living in Diglis, and how the fields filled that gap.

author: Claire Cale
title: Social work drive-through
description: Claire first came across Diglis while visiting as a social worker, and she liked what she saw!

author: James Roe
title: Long walks to play football
description: James remembers long walks to football games becoming shorter thanks to the walking bridge.

author: Serdar 'Smokey' Duman
title: Forming a football club
description: When Smokey was new to Worcester he formed a football club in Diglis to bring his community together.

author: Jon Elger
title: Social strolling
description: Jon walked through Diglis on several occasions to get to and from friends' boats and parties.
